content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --PRESP
      operator: not_exists
    - name: --REASND
      operator: exists
Core:
  Id: CORE-000030
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise and error when --REASND is present in dataset and --PRESP is not
  present in dataset
Outcome:
  Message: --REASND should not be present in dataset when --PRESP is not present in
    dataset
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0053
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: --PRESP[An indication that the event or intervention
                  was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.]|--OCCUR[An indication
                  as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.]
                Document: SDTM v2.0
                Section: Events|Interventions
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0053
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--PRESP/Events) Used to indicate whether the event
                  describe by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified
                  events, null for spontaneously reported events. (--PRESP/Interventions)
                  Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values
                  should be "Y" or null. (--REASND) Used in conjunction with --STAT
                  when value is NOT DONE
                Document: SDTM v1.7
                Section: 2.2.1 (Interventions )|2.2.2 (Events)
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0053
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--PRESP/Events) Used to indicate whether the event
                  describe by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified
                  events, null for spontaneously reported events. (--PRESP/Interventions)
                  Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values
                  should be "Y" or null. (--REASND) Used in conjunction with --STAT
                  when value is NOT DONE
                Document: SDTM v1.4
                Section: 2.2.1 (Interventions )|2.2.2 (Events)
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Exclude:
      - DS
      - DV
      - EX

json.Description: Raise and error when --REASND is present in dataset and --PRESP is not present in dataset

Outcome.Message: --REASND should not be present in dataset when --PRESP is not present in dataset

Citations.Cited_Guidance: --PRESP[An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.]|--OCCUR[An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.]

(--PRESP/Events) Used to indicate whether the event describe by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events. (--PRESP/Interventions) Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null. (--REASND) Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE

(--PRESP/Events) Used to indicate whether the event describe by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events. (--PRESP/Interventions) Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null. (--REASND) Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE
